items.description: Makes the game run in fullscreen. Can be toggled in-game via the "Alt + Enter" key combo.
items.name: Fullscreen

items.description: The monitor the game renders on in the fullscreen mode.
items.name: Default Monitor

items.description: Default width of the game window in pixels.
items.name: Default Window Width

items.description: Default height of the game window in pixels.
items.name: Default Window Height

items.description: Allows you to set a custom screen resolution for the fullscreen mode.
items.name: Custom Fullscreen Resolution

items.description: Width of the custom fullscreen resolution in pixels.
items.name: Fullscreen Resolution Width

items.description: Height of the custom fullscreen resolution in pixels.
items.name: Fullscreen Resolution Height

items.description: Allows you to set a custom internal resolution for the game. Only works with Direct3D backends.
items.name: Custom Internal Resolution

items.description: Width of the custom internal resolution in pixels.
items.name: Internal Resolution Width

items.description: Height of the custom internal resolution in pixels.
items.name: Internal Resolution Height

items.description:
Changes the backend used to render the graphics.
Direct3D 11 is recommended.
items.name: Graphics Backend

items.description: Changes the backend used to render the graphics.
items.name: Graphics Backend

items.description: Changes the base volume for the game's audio output.
items.name: Overall Volume

items.description: Changes the volume of the in-game background music.
items.name: Music Volume

items.description: Changes the volume of various in-game jingles.
items.name: Jingle Volume

items.description: Changes the volume of the sound effects.
items.name: Sound Volume

items.description: Chooses the frame rate the game renders at, using animation interpolation for higher frame rates.
items.name: Frame Rate

items.description: Allows you to change the draw distance for certain objects. Disabling this setting forces the game to always render distant objects. Changes to this setting may affect the gameplay and lead to minor graphical issues.
items.name: Draw Distance

items.description: Sets the level of detail for certain in-game models. "High" is recommended.
items.name: Level of Detail

items.description: Changes the way the textures are filtered. "3 Point" filtering is what's used in the original game, but it only works with the "Direct3D 11" graphics backend.
items.name: Texture Filtering

items.description: Changes the type of noise used for transparency effects. "Chunky" gives the most accurate results.
items.name: Noise Type

items.description: Limits the game's aspect ratio to be roughly the same as the original game on Nintendo 64, regardless of the resolution.
items.name: Force 4:3

items.description: Makes various tweaks to the controls, making them feel tighter and more precise overall.
items.name: Improved Controls

items.description: Makes minor tweaks to the swimming controls, also making them more precise.
items.name: Improved Swimming

items.description: Makes movement when hanging on ceilings faster, and removes the requirement of holding A to stay hanging.
items.name: Improved Hanging

items.description: Makes it so that holding A when jumping on an enemy makes you bounce higher, just like in most other Mario games.
items.name: Enemy Bouncing

items.description: Allows you to control Mario and navigate the menus with the D-Pad.
items.name: D-Pad Controls

items.description: Gives you near full control over Mario's direction in air. This setting significantly alters the way the controls feel and is not recommended for the first-time players.
items.name: Full Air Control

items.description: Fixes various small issues present in the original game. Applying collision fixes might make some speedrunning tricks impossible.
items.name: Apply Bug Fixes

items.description: Saves amount of lives you have to the currently selected save file. In the original game the number of lives resets each time you load a save file.
items.name: Save Lives to Save File

items.description: Makes Koopa shells and blue coin switches respawn after use.
items.name: Make Items Respawn

items.description: Disables warps that send you back to outside Peach's Castle. This setting also prevents you from getting game overs from those warps to prevent them from becoming unfair.
items.name: Remove Inconvenient Warps

items.description: Makes it so that underwater shells last longer and Metal Mario sinks faster, and Metal Mario's interactions become more consistent.
items.name: Improved Powerups

items.description: Tweaks the behavior of some enemies, specifically Boos, Clams, and Tiny Goombas.
items.name: Improved Enemies

items.description: Makes talking with the NPCs easier and more consistent.
items.name: Improved NPCs

items.description: Prevents you from taking damage after hitting the breakable wall required for the "Blast Away the Wall" mission. Recommended when playing with the "Permadeath Mode" enabled.
items.name: Improved "Blast Away the Wall"

items.description: Makes MIPS return to the castle after you collect 120 Power Stars.
items.name: Bring MIPS Back

items.description: Prevents you from taking damage after falling from a distance.
items.name: Disable Fall Damage

items.description: Makes it so that you don't have to be standing still to leave the course from the pause menu. Do not use this to cheat, that wouldn't be very nice!
items.name: Allow Leaving the Course at Any Time

items.description: Gives all the secrets a sparkle effect to make them easier to find. Might make some missions too easy.
items.name: Make Secrets Visible

items.description: Fixes various exploits like the bomb clip, hands-free holding, and Backwards Long Jump. Perfect for those who hate fun.
items.name: Fix Exploits

items.description: Makes Bowser's submarine to always appear in the first mission of Dire Dire Docks, and never in the later ones. It's recommended to leave this enabled if you have no idea what any of this is about.
items.name: Tie Bowser's Sub to Missions

items.description: Allows you to continue playing the game after a getting a Power Star, and makes gameplay changes to make it all work.
items.name: Always Stay in Course

items.description: Skips the mission select screen and always chooses the next available mission. Completing all 6 main missions in a course enables the mission select screen again.
items.name: Skip Mission Select

items.description: Makes completing a mission automatically start the next available one.
items.name: Auto Switch to the Next Mission

items.description: Skips some cutscenes that could become repetitive during repeat playthroughs.
items.name: Skip Cutscenes

items.description:
Changes the default camera mode.
The default mode from the original game is "Lakitu Cam".
items.name: Default Camera Mode

items.description:
Changes the alternate camera mode that you can switch to in-game.
The default mode from the original game is "Mario Cam".
items.name: Alternate Camera Mode

items.description: Allows horizontal analog camera movement using the right analog stick, and removes most camera movement limits.
items.name: Horizontal Analog Camera

items.description: Allows you to tilt the camera vertically using the right analog stick in the "Custom" camera mode.
items.name: Vertical Analog Camera

items.description: Allows you to center the camera behind Mario by pressing L, similarly to the DS version. Doesn't work when the camera is locked.
items.name: Center Camera Button

items.description: Inverts the horizontal camera controls when the "Horizontal Analog Camera" setting is enabled.
items.name: Invert Horizontal Camera Controls

items.description: Inverts the vertical camera controls when the "Verical Analog Camera" setting is enabled.
items.name: Invert Vertical Camera Controls

items.description:
Sets the movement speed of the analog camera.
The default value is 32.
items.name: Analog Camera Speed

items.description:
Pans the camera further away, regardless of the camera mode.
The default value is 0.
items.name: Additional Camera Distance

items.description:
Adds additional field of view over the original.
The default value is 0.
items.name: Additional FoV

items.description:
Adds an "Exit to Desktop" option to the pause menu.
It's the little things that make a difference...
items.name: Add Quit Option

items.description: Redesigns the HUD to make better use of the widescreen resolution.
items.name: HUD Layout

items.description: Centers the HUD as if the screen ratio is 4:3. Makes no practical difference when the "Force 4:3" setting enabled.
items.name: 4:3 HUD

items.description: Shows the stars you've collected in a course in the HUD. Goes well with the "Stay in Course After Getting a Star" setting.
items.name: Show the Collected Stars

items.description: Adds leading zeroes to things like coin and star counters in the HUD.
items.name: Add Zeroes to Counters

items.description: Always shows the indicator for the 100 coin star in both the mission select screen, and the HUD while the "Show the Collected Stars" setting is enabled.
items.name: Always Show the 100 Coin Star

items.description: Prevents the health bar from hiding automatically. Makes no difference when the "Modern" HUD style is used.
items.name: Always Show the Health Meter

items.description: Makes it so that the HUD elements get texture filtering just like the rest of in-game textures. Not recommended with default textures.
items.name: HUD Filtering

items.description: Hides the HUD completely.
items.name: Hide HUD

items.description: Allows you to navigate the menus and control the camera with your mouse. Only fully works when the "Analog Camera" settings are enabled, and works best with the "Custom" camera mode.
items.name: Mouse Support

items.description:
Sets the mouse sensitivity when the "Mouse Support" setting is on.
The default value is 4.
items.name: Mouse Sensitivity

items.description: The action assigned to the left mouse button when the "Mouse Support" setting is on.
items.name: Left Mouse Button Action

items.description: The action assigned to the right mouse button when the "Mouse Support" setting is on.
items.name: Right Mouse Button Action

items.description: The action assigned to the middle mouse button when the "Mouse Support" setting is on.
items.name: Middle Mouse Button Action

items.description: The action assigned to the mouse wheel moving upwards while the "Mouse Support" setting is on.
items.name: Mouse Wheel Up Action

items.description: The action assigned to tthe mouse wheel moving downwards while the "Mouse Support" setting is on.
items.name: Mouse Wheel Down Action

items.description: Introduces wall sliding from later Mario titles and changes how wall jumping works accordingly.
items.name: Wall Sliding

items.description: Allows you to perform a high jump right after performing a ground pound, like seen in most recent 3D Mario titles.
items.name: Ground Pound Jump

items.description: Allows you to do short hops and continue sliding after diving by pressing B, just like in Super Mario Sunshine.
items.name: Sunshine Dive Hop

items.description: Allows you to perform the dive move the same way you would in Super Mario Odyssey.
items.name: Odyssey Ground Pound Dive

items.description: Keep on rollin' baby, you know what time it is.
items.name: Odyssey Rolling

items.description: Gives Mario a little bounce after landing from a ground pound. You can cancel the bounce by holding Z, or perform a slide by holding a direction. Borrowed from Super Mario Flashback.
items.name: Flashback Ground Pound

items.description: Enables the unused pyramid explosion cutscene in Shifting Sand Land.
items.name: Enable the Unused Pyramid Cutscene

items.description: Restores the Bowser defeat cutscene sound effects, and the unused the trapdoor sound for the first star door.
items.name: Restore Unused Sound Effects

items.description: Restores the unused, sad looking eye texture for the mother penguin, as seen in the Shoshinkai 1995 beta footage.
items.name: Restore Mother Penguin's Sad Eyes

items.description: Replaces the regular triple jump with the twirl move, as seen in early gameplay footage.
items.name: Replace Triple Jump w/ Twirl

items.description: Makes the camera behave more like how it did in early gameplay footage, and restores some unused functionality. Might not be 100% accurate.
items.name: Use Beta-like Camera

items.description: Makes Mario sparkle when starting a course, like seen in early gameplay footage.
items.name: Make Mario Sparkle at Course Start

items.description: Adds back a bug from the Japanese version of the game where it shows a star when you grab a key after defeating Bowser.
items.name: Replace Keys w/ Stars When Collected

items.description: Disables the lives system and makes it impossible to get a Game Over.
items.name: Infinite Lives Mode

items.description: Gives every stage an alternate look via different color palettes, and mirrors them all horizontally. A fun way to replay the original game!
items.name: Encore Mode

items.description: Makes it so that 1-Up Mushrooms kill you instantly. Based on the popular challenge with same name.
items.name: Green Demon Mode

items.description: Makes it so that the only way to heal Mario is to collect a Power Star. Also removes all Spinning Hearts.
items.name: No Healing Mode

items.description:
Not only removes Mario's cap so he takes more damage, but also makes the bosses and races harder. Perfect for those who are looking for a bit more challenge!
WARNING: If you start a game, or save to an existing save slot with Hard Mode on that save slot will forever be stuck at Hard Mode!
items.name: Hard Mode

items.description:
You have only 1 hit point! All you need to die is to get hit once, so be careful! At least you can swim as much as you want...
WARNING: If you start a game, or save to an existing save slot with Daredevil Mode on that save slot will forever be stuck at Daredevil Mode!
items.name: Daredevil Mode

items.description:
You have only 1 life! Once you die, your save data gets deleted, with no way to restore it. Only for those who want the ultimate challenge!
WARNING: If you start a game, or save to an existing save slot with Permadeath Mode on that save slot will forever be stuck at Permadeath Mode!
items.name: Permadeath Mode

items.description: Makes Mario not lose any health when underwater, and reduces all damage taken by half.
items.name: Casual Mode

items.description: Makes Mario completely invisible, making it impossible to exactly tell where he is.
items.name: Invisible Mode

items.description:
Allows you to use a predefined color palette.
Setting this to anything other than "Custom" will override your custom color values the next time the game is launched.
items.name: Color Palette

items.description: Main color of Mario's cap.
items.name: Cap Colors Main

items.description: Shading color of Mario's cap.
items.name: Cap Colors Shading

items.description: Main color of Mario's clothes.
items.name: Shirt Colors Main

items.description: Shading color of Mario's clothes.
items.name: Shirt Colors Shading

items.description: Main color of Mario's overalls.
items.name: Overall Colors Main

items.description: Shading color of Mario's overalls.
items.name: Overall Colors Shading

items.description: Main color of Mario's gloves.
items.name: Glove Colors Main

items.description: Shading color of Mario's gloves.
items.name: Glove Colors Shading

items.description: Main color of Mario's shoes.
items.name: Shoe Colors Main

items.description: Shading color of Mario's shoes.
items.name: Shoe Colors Shading

items.description: Main color of Mario's skin.
items.name: Skin Colors Main

items.description: Shading color of Mario's skin.
items.name: Skin Colors Shading

items.description: Main color of Mario's hair.
items.name: Hair Colors Main

items.description: Shading color of Mario's hair.
items.name: Hair Colors Shading

items.description: Makes the "M" logo appear on Mario's cap.
items.name: Show Cap Logo

items.description: Enables the good old debug level select menu.
items.name: Level Select

items.description: Allows you switch to the debug movement mode by pressing L on air. While in it you can move freely using the D-Pad and the analog stick. Enabling this disables "D-Pad Controls".
items.name: Debug Movement Mode

items.description: Enables the unused debug cap changer. Hold L and press a D-Pad direction to change your current cap.
items.name: Debug Cap Changer

items.description: Enables the unused debug object spawner. Hold L and press a D-Pad direction to spawn shells or blocks.
items.name: Debug Object Spawner

items.description: Allows you to hold L to float. "Classic" mimics how the old moon jump GameShark code worked back in the day, while "Fixed" fixes the issues with it.
items.name: Moon Jump

items.description: Allows you to perform a BLJ out of thin air. Shoutouts to Kaze.
items.name: BLJ Everywhere

items.description: IDDQD
items.name: God Mode

items.description: The problem of being faster than light is that you can only live in darkness.
items.name: Hyperspeed Mode

items.description: Allows you to rotate the cannons more than you're supposed to.
items.name: No Cannon Limits

items.description:
Allows you to change the amount of coins required for the coin stars.
The default value is 100, anything higher is not recommended.
items.name: Coins Required for the Coin Stars

items.description: Changes Mario's victory pose randomly to rock, paper or scissors, just like Super Mario Odyssey.
items.name: Rock Paper Scissors

items.description: What would YOU do if your child was murdered right in front of your eyes?
items.name: Mad Penguin

items.description: You guys like Paper Mario?
items.name: Paper Mode

items.description: Makes the game use a single color for all surfaces. Was originally made for a certain fake leak.
items.name: FX Mode

items.description: Renders everything in wireframe mode. Only works with the Direct3D backends.
items.name: Wireframe Mode

items.description: Disables the in-game lighting, giving everything a flatter look.
items.name: Disable Lighting

items.description: Shows the built-in in-game debug text.
items.name: Show Debug Display

items.description: Shows the built-in debug profiler. Doesn't work, I think?
items.name: Show Debug Profiler

items.description: The refresh rate that will be used for when "Custom Fullscreen Resolution" is enabled. 60 is recommended.
items.name: Fullscreen Refresh Rate

items.description:
Sets the default camera distance when using the "Modern" and "Custom" camera settings.
The default value is 100.
items.name: Custom Camera Distance

items.description:
Sets the zoomed out camera distance when using the "Modern" and "Custom" camera settings.
The default value is 180.
items.name: Zoomed Out Custom Camera Distance

items.description: The controller button assigned to the A button.
items.name: A (Jump)

items.description: The controller button assigned to the B button.
items.name: B (Punch)

items.description: The controller button assigned to the Start button.
items.name: Start (Pause)

items.description: The controller button assigned to the L trigger.
items.name: L (Center Camera)

items.description: The controller button assigned to the R trigger.
items.name: R (Change Camera)

items.description: The controller button assigned to the Z trigger.
items.name: Z (Crouch)

items.description: The controller button assigned to the C-Up button.
items.name: C-Up (Zoom In)

items.description: The controller button assigned to the C-Down button.
items.name: C-Down (Zoom Out)

items.description: The controller button assigned to the C-Left button.
items.name: C-Left (Rotate Left)

items.description: The controller button assigned to the C-Right button.
items.name: C-Right (Rotate Right)

items.description:
Adjusts the left analog stick deadzone of your controller.
The default value is 512.
items.name: Left Analog Stick Deadzone

items.description:
Adjusts the right analog stick deadzone of your controller.
The default value is 512.
items.name: Right Analog Stick Deadzone

items.description:
Enables and sets the strength of the controller rumble effect.
Works the same way as the Super Mario 3D All-Stars and the Shindou Edition.
items.name: Rumble Strength

items.description:
The keyboard key assigned to the A button.
The value is a DirectInput scan code.
items.name: A (Jump)

items.description:
The keyboard key assigned to the B button.
The value is a DirectInput scan code.
items.name: B (Punch)

items.description:
The keyboard key assigned to the Start button.
The value is a DirectInput scan code.
items.name: Start (Pause)

items.description:
The keyboard key assigned to the L trigger.
The value is a DirectInput scan code.
items.name: L (Center Camera)

items.description:
The keyboard key assigned to the R trigger.
The value is a DirectInput scan code.
items.name: R (Change Camera)

items.description:
The keyboard key assigned to the Z trigger.
The value is a DirectInput scan code.
items.name: Z (Crouch)

items.description:
The keyboard key assigned to the C-Up button.
The value is a DirectInput scan code.
items.name: C-Up (Zoom In)

items.description:
The keyboard key assigned to the C-Down button.
The value is a DirectInput scan code.
items.name: C-Down (Zoom Out)

items.description:
The keyboard key assigned to the C-Left button.
The value is a DirectInput scan code.
items.name: C-Left (Rotate Left)

items.description:
The keyboard key assigned to the C-Right button.
The value is a DirectInput scan code.
items.name: C-Right (Rotate Right)

items.description:
The keyboard key assigned to the stick up action.
The value is a DirectInput scan code.
items.name: Stick Up

items.description:
The keyboard key assigned to the stick down action.
The value is a DirectInput scan code.
items.name: Stick Down

items.description:
The keyboard key assigned to the stick left action.
The value is a DirectInput scan code.
items.name: Stick Left

items.description:
The keyboard key assigned to the stick right action.
The value is a DirectInput scan code.
items.name: Stick Right

items.description:
The keyboard key that makes Mario walk slowly when held down.
The value is a DirectInput scan code.
items.name: Walk Trigger
